macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Close Sharply Lower on Feb 6 Amid AI Spending and Labor Concerns
items.summary: The Dow Jones fell 1.2% to 48,908.72, Nasdaq dropped 1.6% to 22,540.59, and S&P 500 declined 1.2% to 6,798.4, with tech and discretionary sectors hit hardest due to fears over AI capital spending and weak labor market signals. The VIX surged 16.8% to 21.77 as decliners outnumbered advancers.

items.title: US Stocks Rebound Intraday on Feb 6 After Early Selloff, Tech Sector Leads Recovery
items.summary: Major indices including Dow Jones, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 staged widespread rebounds during Feb 6 trading, with Nasdaq up 3.37% from lows and Dow outperforming amid reduced anxiety ahead of NFP data. Markets eye dovish Fed cut odds at 15% for March.

items.title: Hawkish Fed Chair Comments Weigh on US Equities in Latest Session
items.summary: US equities ended down 0.09% influenced by hawkish Fed chair remarks and a metals sector reset, despite supportive ISM data and strong earnings providing brief lifts.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds to $70,000 After Touching $60,000 Low, Boosting Financial Stocks
items.summary: Cryptocurrencies rebounded sharply with Bitcoin surging from an overnight low of $60,000 to around $70,000 by week's end, driving gains in financial stocks including Coinbase and Robinhood. The recovery followed a midweek slump amid fading fears over private-credit investments.

items.title: Crypto Market Crash Wipes Out Billions, Erasing Post-Trump Election Gains
items.summary: Bitcoin plunged nearly 50% from its October highs to a low of just over $60,000 amid a market rout, the deepest decline since 2022, fueled by concerns over risky assets and impacting public companies like MicroStrategy. The crash highlights crypto's volatility despite growing political influence under President Trump.

items.title: Bitcoin's $15,000 Crash Linked to Hong Kong Hedge Funds' Leveraged Bets Imploding
items.summary: A massive Bitcoin drop of nearly $15,000 in 24 hours is attributed to the liquidation of high-leverage call options on BlackRock's IBIT ETF by Hong Kong hedge funds, creating a perfect storm of forced selling. Bitcoin has since recovered to around $70,000, with theories awaiting regulatory confirmation.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Announces Major Breakthrough in Multimodal AI Reasoning
items.summary: OpenAI has launched a new model capable of seamlessly processing text, images, audio, and video simultaneously, achieving human-like understanding and a 40% improvement in multi-step reasoning tasks compared to previous models.

items.title: Cerebras Raises $1 Billion Series H at $23 Billion Valuation
items.summary: Cerebras Systems secured $1 billion in funding to scale its wafer-scale AI technology, highlighting significant investment in advanced AI hardware amid growing industry demand.

items.title: Snowflake and OpenAI Forge $200 Million Partnership for Cortex AI
items.summary: Snowflake partnered with OpenAI in a multi-year, $200 million deal to make models like GPT-5.2 natively available in Snowflake Cortex AI, enabling 12,600+ customers to build context-aware AI agents on governed data.

items.title: Humanoid.ai Launches KinetIQ AI Framework for Robot Fleets
items.summary: Humanoid.ai introduced KinetIQ, a cross-timescale AI system for orchestrating humanoid and wheeled robot fleets in industrial and home settings, featuring agentic task allocation and omni-modal reasoning.

items.title: NVIDIA Announces Rubin Platform with Vera Rubin R100 Architecture
items.summary: NVIDIA revealed the Rubin platform, set for H2 2026 production, featuring Vera CPU and HBM4 memory for a 10x reduction in AI inference cost-per-token, alongside Spectrum-X networking advancements.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase Reveals New Games and Demos
items.summary: The February 5th Nintendo Direct Partner Showcase announced demos for Monster Hunter Stories 3: Twisted Reflection and PRAGMATA, plus global reveals of Kyoto Xanadu and Paranormasight: The Mermaid’s Curse for Switch and Switch 2.

items.title: Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined, Nioh 3, and Other Major Games Release This Week
items.summary: Highly anticipated releases this week include Dragon Quest 7 Reimagined, Nioh 3, Cairn, MY HERO ACADEMIA: All’s Justice, and PUBG: Blindspot.

items.title: Ustwo Games Announces Layoffs for 'PC-First' Strategy Pivot
items.summary: Ustwo Games is making layoffs to shift focus to a 'PC-first' development strategy.

items.title: Ares Interactive Secures $70 Million Investment
items.summary: Mobile studio Ares Interactive has secured a $70 million investment to support its development efforts.

items.title: Take-Two Reports Strong Quarter as GTA Exceeds Forecasts
items.summary: Take-Two Interactive delivered an 'outstanding' quarter with GTA sales beating forecasts; president also dismissed Google's Genie as not a game engine replacement.

items.title: Microsoft Exploring Early Stages of Xbox Game Pass Expansion
items.summary: Microsoft is reportedly in the early stages of further expanding Xbox Game Pass following last year's overhaul with new tiers and perks.

items.title: Mario Tennis Fever Set for February 12 Release
items.summary: Nintendo's Mario Tennis Fever launches on February 12, emphasizing exaggerated, character-driven arcade sports gameplay.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Memory shortages hit smartphone chip demand, impacting Qualcomm and Arm
items.summary: A global memory chip shortage is reducing smartphone production, leading to weaker orders for Qualcomm and lower royalty revenue expectations for Arm due to softer processor shipments.

items.title: Nvidia delays RTX 50-series Super refresh due to AI chip priorities and RAM constraints
items.summary: Nvidia is postponing its RTX 50-series Super graphics card refresh to prioritize AI hardware amid ongoing memory shortages affecting both gaming and data center products.

items.title: Samsung teases Galaxy S26 camera upgrades ahead of February launch
items.summary: Samsung has released teasers highlighting improved zoom and low-light video capabilities for the upcoming Galaxy S26 series, positioning computational imaging as a key upgrade feature.

items.title: Huawei announces Feb. 26 global launch event in Madrid for new consumer hardware
items.summary: Huawei is hosting its first Global Innovative Product launch of 2026 on February 26 in Madrid, teasing multiple new devices despite ongoing geopolitical and market challenges.
